Kaj je nujno preveriti pred zimo?
07 Nov 2019, 14:59 by Artur Švarc

Po indijanskem poletju se je v začetku novembra jesen končno odločila, da gre proti zimi. To pomeni tudi nekaj napotkov za vaše jeklene konjičke.



Zimske gume je treba pravočasno namesti na avtomobil. Zakonski rok je 15. november.  Foto: Škoda

Najprej: s 15. novembrom obvezne zimske gume, nekateri prelazi pa so že zdaj pobeljeni. A še pred snežnimi padavinami pričakujemo jesensko deževno obdobje, temperature blizu ledišča pa lahko pomenijo tudi spremenjene pogoje na asfaltni podlagi. Kaj lahko storite sami, da bo prehod v temni del leta bolj enostaven?
1. Preverite vse žarnice v lučeh na vašem avtomobilu in jih po potrebi zamenjajte. Luči naj bodo redno očiščene umazanije, da boste bolje videli (in bili vidni).
2. Ne odlašajte z menjavo gum za zimske, kakšen teden prej pomeni tudi manj gneče pri vulkanizerjih, prav tako preverite globino profila in redno tudi tlak v gumah.
3. Preverite stanje akumulatorja. Prehod v deževno in hladnejšo dobo preseneti mnoge voznike s praznim akumulatorjem, sploh če je avto v vlažnem okolju in če dlje časa stoji.
4. Preverite čistilo za vetrobransko steklo. Po potrebi s seboj vozite večjo plastenko že pripravljene tekočine za dolivanje. Ni večje težave kot umazane šipe s prazno posodo za čistilo.
5. Preverite hladilno tekočino v motorju, sploh sredstvo proti zmrzovanju. Motor, hlajen samo z vodo in temperature pod ničlo ne dajejo ravno najboljšega rezultata za dolgo življenje motorja.
6. Preverite stanje brisalcev. Strgana guma pomeni, da bodo umazanijo le razmazali. Preverite tako sprednje kot zadnje brisalce, če jih vaš avto ima. In ko bo na steklu zmrzal, nikar ne uporabljajte brisalcev za čiščenje, saj jih s tem pospešeno uničite. Vsekakor naj ima vaš avto na dostopnem mestu tudi strgalo za led.

What is essential to check before winter?
07 Nov 2019, 14:59 by Artur Schwartz

After the Indian summer, in early November, autumn finally decided to go against winter. This also means some guidance for your steel hobbies.



Winter tires should be fitted to the car in a timely manner. The legal deadline is November 15. Photo: Too bad

First of all: winter tires are mandatory with November 15, and some passes are already whitewashed. However, even before the snowfall, the autumn rainy season is expected, and temperatures near freezing can also mean changed conditions on the asphalt surface. What can you do yourself to make the transition to the dark part of the year easier?
1. Check all the lamps in the lights on your car and replace if necessary. Keep your lights clean for dirt on a regular basis so you can see (and be visible) better.
2. Do not delay the change of winter tires, which means less crowding in the previous week, and also check the depth of the profile and the tire pressure regularly.
3. Check the battery status. The transition to a rainy and colder era will surprise many drivers with a low battery, even if the car is in a humid environment and if it stays for a long time.
4. Check the windscreen cleaner. If necessary, bring a larger bottle of ready-made filling liquid with you. There is no bigger problem than dirty piles with an empty cleaner container.
5. Check engine coolant, especially antifreeze. A water-cooled engine and sub-zero temperatures do not exactly produce the best result for a long engine life.
6. Check the condition of the wipers. Torn rubber means that they will only smear the dirt. Check both front and rear wipers if your car has one. And when it freezes on the glass, do not use wipers to clean it as it will quickly destroy them. Make sure your car has an ice scraper in an accessible location.
